beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Sea Otter Classic Gravel. Monterey, California. 89 mi. Fast fire roads with coastal character. More about the experience than pure gravel suffering.

beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Let's go through the scores. Logistics. 5 out of 5. Military precision. Every detail dialed. Everything happens at WeatherTech Raceway Laguna Seca with packet pickup running Wednesday through Sunday morning. Prestige. 5 out of 5. Gravel royalty. The race everyone knows. Olympic silver medalist Haley Batten won her first-ever gravel race here, while Keegan Swenson claimed his fourth consecutive Sea Otter victory. Race Quality. 5 out of 5. Everything about this race is dialed. The three-lap format provides clean field separation while Simon Pellaud could ride "30 kilometers solo at the front" before being caught by chasers. Experience. 5 out of 5. This race ruins other races for you. Simon Pellaud noted "Sea Otter is much more than just a gravel race — it's a true cycling festival. Community. 5 out of 5. Strangers become friends by mile ten. Ten thousand athletes across 14 disciplines creates cycling's biggest gathering. Field Depth. 5 out of 5. World-class athletes. And they race hard. Adventure. 4 out of 5. Remote terrain. Self-sufficiency required. The Start Section requires climbing "out of the racetrack and onto half a mile of single track, then a fast but loose 3 mile descent. Expenses. 4 out of 5. Your wallet will survive this one. Monterey in April means hotel rates surge during cycling's biggest festival weekend, requiring early booking.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: And the rest of the scorecard. Technicality. 3 out of 5. Requires line choice. Rewards the attentive rider. Elevation. 3 out of 5. Enough vertical to remind you gravity exists. Value. 3 out of 5. The math works out. Barely. Length. 2 out of 5. Won't destroy your week. Climate. 2 out of 5. Mild conditions. Nothing dramatic. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Sea level. Your lungs get a day off.

strengths: The festival: 10,000+ cyclists, every brand, endless content.
The destination: Monterey is gorgeous. Make it a long weekend.
The accessibility: Not an intimidating course for mid-level riders.

beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Festival First, Race Second. Yes if you want the full Sea Otter experience and gravel is your discipline. No if you're looking for a pure gravel bucket-list race.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Sea Otter Classic Gravel isn't quite right for you. If you want California gravel without the circus: Lost & Found, Grasshopper. If you want the expo but different racing: Sea Otter MTB or road events.
